change.li: $Log: encyclopedia.xml,v $ Revision 1.28 2006/03/27 14:02:23 gcrane more refinements Revision 1.27 2006/03/26 04:13:20 gcrane more fixes Revision 1.26 2006/03/25 19:26:47 gcrane more fixes Revision 1.25 2006/03/25 16:38:06 gcrane Did a lot of work to clean up the base headers for subentries. These should more often now only include global descriptions, e.g, PERSON, son of A stays, but PERSON, fought at Troy goes. --> "Fought at Troy" can be one of many events and is not a global identifier Revision 1.24 2006/03/20 19:15:42 gcrane cleaned up the formatting Revision 1.23 2006/03/20 14:15:22 gcrane small changes Revision 1.20 2006/03/18 15:34:36 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.19 2006/03/18 01:14:23 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.18 2006/03/17 23:55:18 gaweaver small fixes Revision 1.17 2006/03/17 21:56:39 gaweaver Calliopi From Antiphon until Chilon Revision 1.16 2006/03/17 15:39:04 gaweaver no message Revision 1.15 2006/03/10 00:01:20 gaweaver changes made by GRC while over the atlantic Revision 1.14 2006/03/05 03:47:42 gcrane base file Revision 1.13 2006/03/04 13:13:03 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.12 2006/03/03 18:21:05 gaweaver Agenor (10) Revision 1.11 2006/02/15 16:24:46 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.10 2006/02/13 21:52:23 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.9 2006/02/13 01:57:42 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.8 2006/02/12 23:12:05 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.7 2006/02/12 15:30:08 gcrane major structural update: the descriptive info has now been moved up into the headers and id's added to div1 type="entry" Revision 1.6 2006/02/12 13:23:59 gcrane moved descriptions up into the header: the goal is to make the header more informative and thus to facilitate the mechanics of aligning entries in this list with those in Smith's etc Revision 1.5 2006/02/11 19:49:21 gcrane more small fixes to make the coding consistent Revision 1.4 2006/02/11 18:50:04 gcrane working towards moving identifiers for all entities up into the subentry HEAD Revision 1.3 2006/02/10 22:43:14 gcrane changed the structure so that every entry has a subentry -- this simplifies the structure (i hope) Revision 1.2 2005/08/18 13:53:45 packel item tags... Revision 1.1 2005/07/25 14:32:52 packel Converted to XML Revision 1.34 2003/07/01 22:16:05 yorkc Updated texts to TEI P4 and Perseus P4 extensions; minor cleanup (esp. character encodings and typos.) Revision 1.33 2000/03/16 03:17:12 dasmith Gave homonym entries a top-level header. Revision 1.32 2000/03/16 02:52:18 dasmith Added alphabetic letter DIV0s. Made entries subordinate to alphabetic letters in refsDecl. Revision 1.31 2000/03/15 15:12:45 amahoney make homonyms sub-entries Revision 1.30 2000/03/14 18:11:05 amahoney several more random issues, but the Apollodorus refs really are right now Revision 1.27 2000/03/04 20:34:25 dasmith Added separate funder entity to TEI header. Revision 1.26 2000/02/22 17:17:30 amahoney fix bibl refs to known works Revision 1.25 2000/02/04 17:58:05 dasmith Primary lookup by ID (mostly useful for internal navigation). Revision 1.24 2000/01/10 21:09:41 acsmith trying again to change pilaster def. Revision 1.23 2000/01/10 20:16:54 dasmith Fixed sentence grammar. Revision 1.22 1999/10/01 14:11:04 acsmith Amy did away with dangling ref. to Type A2 cup, and turned all Type A1 cups into Type A cups, and lower cased type in Proto type A cup. Revision 1.21 1999/09/30 21:52:22 dasmith Fixed amphorae cross-refs. Revision 1.20 1999/09/30 21:08:38 acsmith ACS fixed (hopefully!) amphorae and pyxides Revision 1.19 1999/09/29 15:55:28 dasmith Converted to TEI2 tagging.

div3.p: A variety of stone used in stone construction; a metamorphic rock, coarse grained and characterized by layering of bonded and/or similar minerals.
Description: Often described as streaky due to its prominent layering. Composed of feldspars, quartz, mica, amphibole and garnet.

div2.subhead: Graea, name of woman and of Tanagra

div3.p: a term given to the Archaic through Classical art found in Western Turkey that shows influences of Greek and Persian (or Achaemenid) styles
An inscription scratched on the surface of a Greek vase after firing, and most often found on the underside of the vessel.

Description: A graffito inscription can include a signature, ligature, marks, groups of letters or groups of numbers. Graffiti differ from dipinti in that graffiti are signature, ligature marks, groups of letters or groups of numbers scratched into the surface of the vase, rather than painted on the vessel's surface.
A variety of stone used in construction; an igneous, granular texture.
Description: Composed primarily of feldspar and quartz, also composed of mica. Generally pinkish in color, also grays and white.

at Olympia: Paus. 5.10.7, Paus. 5.15.10, Paus. 5.18.6, Paus. 5.20.4
leader of the Aeanianians against Troy: Apollod. E.3.13, Paus. 8.18.2
settles in Libya: Apollod. E.6.14, Apollod. E.6.15

div3.p: Drops, shaped like the frustra of cones, used principally in the architrave, and under the taenia, but sometimes also applied under the mutules of the order.

Description: The guttae are also called trunnels. They appear along the underside of the regula, below the triglyphs, as six stone pegs, arranged in a single row. On the cornice they appear on the underside of the mutules, where they number eighteen, in three rows of six. The guttae of the regula correspond to the guttae of the mutule above. They represented the drops of water which distil from above, and hang in pendent drops below.

div2.subhead: Gygaea, daughter of Amyntas of Macedonia

his accession after murdering Candaules: Hdt. 1.8-13
gymnasium of Hadrian at Athens: Paus. 1.18.9

div2.subhead: Gyzantes, a tribe in the western part of Libya
